intro: Endlicheria lorastemon, commonly known as the Lorastemon Endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
